11-year-old.context: The patient is an 11-year-old male who was admitted from the ER after a CT scan suggested that the child had mastoiditis.

mastoiditis.context: The patient is an 11-year-old male who was admitted from the ER after a CT scan suggested that the child had mastoiditis.

acute otitis media.context: Discharge Diagnoses: 1. Suspected mastoiditis ruled out.   2. Right acute otitis media.

severe ear pain.context: Discharge Diagnoses: 1. Suspected mastoiditis ruled out.   2. Right acute otitis media.   3. Severe ear pain resolving.

blood draining.context: The child has had very severe ear pain and blood draining from the right ear.

temperature.context: The child had a temperature maximum of 101.4 in the ER.

IV Unasyn.context: The patient was admitted and started on IV Unasyn, which he tolerated well and required Morphine and Vicodin for pain control.

Morphine.context: The patient was admitted and started on IV Unasyn, which he tolerated well and required Morphine and Vicodin for pain control.

Vicodin.context: The patient was admitted and started on IV Unasyn, which he tolerated well and required Morphine and Vicodin for pain control.

pain control.context: The patient was admitted and started on IV Unasyn, which he tolerated well and required Morphine and Vicodin for pain control.

IV fluid.context: The child was continued on IV fluid and narcotics for pain as well as Unasyn until the time of discharge.

narcotics.context: The child was continued on IV fluid and narcotics for pain as well as Unasyn until the time of discharge.

Unasyn.context: The child was continued on IV fluid and narcotics for pain as well as Unasyn until the time of discharge.

Dr. X.context: After reviewing the CT scan, it was felt that the CT scan was not consistent with mastoiditis. The child was continued on IV fluid and narcotics for pain as well as Unasyn until the time of discharge.

CT scan.context: After reviewing the CT scan, it was felt that the CT scan was not consistent with mastoiditis.

area behind his ear.context: The area behind his ear is nontender.

posterior chains node.context: There is a large posterior chains node that is nontender and the swelling in this area has decreased markedly.

Ciprodex Otic Solution.context: Discharge Medications: 1. Ciprodex Otic Solution in the right ear twice daily.   2. Augmentin 500 mg three times daily x10 days.

Augmentin.context: Discharge Medications: 1. Ciprodex Otic Solution in the right ear twice daily.   2. Augmentin 500 mg three times daily x10 days.

Dr. Y.context: Follow Up: 1. Dr. Y in one week (ENT).   2. The primary care physician in 2 to 28 days.

primary care physician.context: Follow Up: 1. Dr. Y in one week (ENT).   2. The primary care physician in 2 to 28 days.
